article:
'Daniel Day Wiley' (August 10, 1837 â€“ January 25, 1893) was an
American Union brevet brigadier general during the period of the American Civil
War. He enlisted in the 21st regiment. He received his appointment as
brevet brigadier general dated to March 13, 1865.

After the war, he was a Republican candidate for the legislature but was
narrowly defeated. He was never married.
categories: People of Vermont in the American Civil War
